description: 10 real sample incentive programs from IncentEdge production database. Mix of federal, state, local, and utility programs. All verified and live.

programs.name: Section 45L New Energy Efficient Home Credit
programs.description: 45L provides a $5,000 per dwelling unit tax credit for the construction of new energy-efficient homes meeting specific energy efficiency standards. Available through December 31, 2033 under the Inflation Reduction Act.
eligibilitySummary: New residential dwelling units
Must meet IRS energy efficiency standards (25-50% better than IECC 2006)
Individual or corporate developer

programs.name: Section 179D Energy Efficient Commercial Building Deduction
programs.description: 179D allows a deduction of up to $5 per square foot for qualified energy-efficient commercial building property placed in service. Available for buildings meeting ASHRAE 90.1 2007 standards.
eligibilitySummary: Commercial buildings placed in service after 2005
Must comply with ASHRAE 90.1-2007 energy standards
Building envelope, HVAC, lighting, and hot water systems must qualify

programs.name: Investment Tax Credit (ITC) for Solar & Storage
programs.description: 30% Investment Tax Credit for commercial and residential solar photovoltaic systems, energy storage systems, and qualifying renewable energy properties. Domestic content bonus credits available.
eligibilitySummary: Solar PV, energy storage, wind, geothermal systems
Residential and commercial eligible
Domestic content bonus: +10% (subject to wage and apprenticeship requirements)

programs.name: Low-Income Housing Tax Credit (4%)
programs.description: 4% LIHTC via tax-exempt bond financing for qualified affordable housing development. As-of-right allocation for developments meeting income and rent restrictions.
eligibilitySummary: Affordable rental housing (income-restricted to 60% AMI)
New construction or substantial rehabilitation
10-year compliance period minimum

programs.name: NYSERDA New Construction Program
programs.description: Performance-based incentive for new commercial construction and major renovations achieving NYSERDA Tier 1 or Tier 2 efficiency targets.
eligibilitySummary: New commercial construction or major renovation
Must meet NYSERDA Tier 1 or Tier 2 requirements
Building performance path or prescriptive path available

programs.name: Westchester IDA PILOT Program
programs.description: 20-year graduated property tax abatement from Westchester County Industrial Development Agency for qualified real estate development projects in designated areas.
eligibilitySummary: Real estate development in designated IDA project areas
Commercial, mixed-use, or residential projects
Minimum project size and cost requirements apply

programs.name: Low-Income Housing Tax Credit (9%)
programs.description: Competitive 9% LIHTC allocation for qualified affordable housing development. Higher credit percentage than 4% but requires competitive application.
eligibilitySummary: Affordable rental housing (income-restricted to 60% AMI)
New construction or substantial rehabilitation
Competitive application to state housing finance agency

programs.name: New Markets Tax Credit (NMTC)
programs.description: 39% tax credit for qualified equity investments in Community Development Entities serving low-income communities. Critical for underserved area development.
eligibilitySummary: Investment in qualified Community Development Entities (CDEs)
Project located in low-income community
Community development purposes required

programs.name: Con Edison Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.description: Commercial energy efficiency equipment rebates for HVAC, lighting, refrigeration, and process equipment upgrades in Con Edison service territory.
eligibilitySummary: Con Edison commercial service customer
Qualifying energy efficiency equipment
Standard equipment manufacturer specifications required

programs.name: Property Assessed Clean Energy (PACE) Financing
programs.description: PACE enables property owners to finance energy efficiency, renewable energy, and sustainable infrastructure through special property tax assessment. $180M+ available in NY.
eligibilitySummary: Commercial or residential property in PACE-enabled jurisdiction
Energy efficiency, renewable energy, or water/stormwater improvements
Property must have sufficient equity or creditworthiness
